intro: Neillia bracteata, commonly known as the bracteate neillia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and distinctive bracteate structures that surround the inflorescence. It typically grows in tropical rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
